Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian pottery chalice with handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added red bands; exterior: reserved; on left break, trace of undetermined motif; on cul, guilloche between narrow lines.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the much smaller British Museum 1886,0401.1064. According to Lemos, the sherd belongs within the Wild Goat Style. Whilst the interior decoration and the guilloche in the handle zone are consistent with the Wild Goat Style, the largely reserved upper body is not typical of it, but rather of the style of the patterned chalices. The sherd, as demonstrated from the lack of interior decoration, is early.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 29)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, no. 214)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0266) (phase 2)
